Vehicle.name: vehicleSpecialUsage
Vehicle.desc: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi. The legislation in many countries requires this information to be revealed when offering a car for sale.

Vehicle.name: numberOfForwardGears
Vehicle.desc:
The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): C62

Vehicle.name: mileageFromOdometer
Vehicle.desc:
The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.

Typical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles

Vehicle.name: vehicleInteriorColor
Vehicle.desc: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

Vehicle.name: steeringPosition
Vehicle.desc: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

Vehicle.name: vehicleEngine
Vehicle.desc: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

Vehicle.name: vehicleModelDate
Vehicle.desc: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

Vehicle.name: numberOfDoors
Vehicle.desc:
The number of doors.

Typical unit code(s): C62

Vehicle.name: vehicleConfiguration
Vehicle.desc: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

Vehicle.name: fuelType
Vehicle.desc: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

Vehicle.name: vehicleIdentificationNumber
Vehicle.desc: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

Vehicle.name: fuelConsumption
Vehicle.desc:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).

  • Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km. Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.
  • Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
  • Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

Vehicle.name: numberOfPreviousOwners
Vehicle.desc:
The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.

Typical unit code(s): C62

Vehicle.name: fuelEfficiency
Vehicle.desc:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).

  • Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter. Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.
  • Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
  • Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

Vehicle.name: numberOfAxles
Vehicle.desc:
The number of axles.

Typical unit code(s): C62

Vehicle.name: vehicleInteriorType
Vehicle.desc: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

Vehicle.name: knownVehicleDamages
Vehicle.desc: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

Vehicle.name: numberOfAirbags
Vehicle.desc: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

Vehicle.name: vehicleSeatingCapacity
Vehicle.desc:
The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.

Typical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

Vehicle.name: cargoVolume
Vehicle.desc:
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feet

Note: You can use minValue and maxValue to indicate ranges.

Vehicle.name: vehicleTransmission
Vehicle.desc: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

Vehicle.name: dateVehicleFirstRegistered
Vehicle.desc: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

Vehicle.name: purchaseDate
Vehicle.desc: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

Vehicle.name: productionDate
Vehicle.desc: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

Vehicle.name: driveWheelConfiguration
Vehicle.desc: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.
